column4: for a desktop user his home dir is more important than anything else
he is only worried of a perception of lost space
sorry, I haven't been following so you've completely lost me :)
i tried telling him it is not wise. He is a desktop user who thinks having empty dir means he has an empty unutilized space on his harddisk
isn't dpkg, apt-get and aptitude all have different list. Wouldn't it depend on which front end was used for installations?
they all use the same database I believe
no i know for a fact that aptitude do not honor apt-get list
what do you mean?  can you give me an example I can try?
installed the fglrx package after compilation using dpkg aptitude report it as broken. also installing using apt-get aptitude report them as broken and mark them for removal
what did you install using apt-get that aptitude reported as broken?
i seen it documented as a problem with aptitude that it does not honor apt-get and dpkg lists
do you happen to still have a link to the document anywhere?
